tool.name: PiperTable
tool.displayname: Plot Piper and Points from CSV

param.name: chem_file
param.dialogReference:
Csv with headers on first row. Should included location values and columns for major ions.

Ex: Latitude, Longitude, Ca, Mg, Na, K, HCO3, CO3, Cl, SO4

param.name: head_names
param.dialogReference: Match your table columns to the parameters of the script. Remove rows from this list that you do not have data for.

param.name: usetds
param.dialogReference: Check this box to vary point size by the calculated TDS values.

param.name: scaletds
param.dialogReference: This is an arbitrary scaling factor that will vary the resulting point sizes of the TDS values on the piper plot.

tool.summary: Generate piper plot, estimate TDS, and calculate charge balance from a csv file.
tool.usage:
Should have a csv with X and Y location fields, an ID (optional), and the major ions used for a piper plot. Ions not entered will be treated as 0 values.

Ca, Mg, Na, K, HCO3, CO3, Cl, SO4

NaK is optional and can be used.

The resulting plot will be a piper plot, a new csv in the directory of the original csv, and a feature class of the data. The points of the feature class can be colored using the hex fields if using arcgis pro. Follow these instructions to do so: http://pro.arcgis.com/en/pro-app/help/mapping/symbols-and-styles/attribute-driven-symbology.htm
